abstract: All eyes are on the next steps that Jerry Yang, the company’s co-founder, will take to rejuvenate the troubled business.
snippet: All eyes are on the next steps that Jerry Yang, the company’s co-founder, will take to rejuvenate the troubled business.
lead_paragraph: Should Yahoo stop trying to beat Google at its own game? Should it step up the pace and grow even larger through mergers and acquisitions?

headline.main: After Shake-Up, What Now for Yahoo?
headline.print_headline: After Shake-Up, What Now for Yahoo?

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Andrew Ross Sorkin

abstract: The changes are in response to a complaint by Google that a feature of the operating system is anticompetitive.
snippet: The changes are in response to a complaint by Google that a feature of the operating system is anticompetitive.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 20 — Microsoft has agreed to make changes to its Windows Vista operating system in response to a complaint by Google that a feature of Vista is anticompetitive, lawyers involved in the case said on Tuesday.

abstract: Google has acquired an online slide presentation company, Zenter, filling out its web-based office software portfolio with an application similar to Microsoft‘s popular PowerPoint.
lead_paragraph: Google has acquired an online slide presentation company, Zenter, filling out its web-based office software portfolio with an application similar to Microsoft‘s popular PowerPoint.

headline.main: With Zenter Deal, Google Makes Its Own PowerPoint

abstract: As industry watchers tried to divine whether Yahoo would be put in play following the the resignation of Terry S. Semel as the Internet giant’s chief executive, The New York Times suggested that another radical proposition is being whispered inside and outside the company: stop trying to beat Google at its own game.
lead_paragraph: As industry watchers tried to divine whether Yahoo would be put in play following the the resignation of Terry S. Semel as the Internet giant’s chief executive, The New York Times suggested that another radical proposition is being whispered inside and outside the company: stop trying to beat Google at its own game.

headline.main: After Shake-Up, What Now for Yahoo?

abstract: It’s become a monthly ritual with few surprises. Web audience measuring firms report numbers for Web search traffic in the United States. Yahoo does well. Google does a lot better. Microsoft and others barely hold on, or worse.
lead_paragraph: It’s become a monthly ritual with few surprises. Web audience measuring firms report numbers for Web search traffic in the United States. Yahoo does well. Google does a lot better. Microsoft and others barely hold on, or worse.

headline.main: Yahoo Good, Google Better (a Lot Better)
